verses.text: These \w were|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H4480"\w* \w divisions|strong="H4256"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H4480"\w* \w gatekeepers|strong="H7778"\w*: From the Korahites: Meshelemiah son of Kore, one of the sons of Asaph.
Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Eliehoenai the seventh.
And Obed-edom also had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sachar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, and Peullethai the eighth. For God had blessed Obed-edom.
Also to his son Shemaiah were born sons who ruled over their families because they were strong, capable men.
Shemaiah’s sons were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad; his brothers were Elihu and Semachiah, also capable men.
All these were descendants of Obed-edom; they and their sons and brothers were capable men with strength to do the work—62 in all from Obed-edom.
Meshelemiah also had sons and brothers who were capable men—18 in all.
Hosah the Merarite also had sons: Shimri the first (although he was not the firstborn, his father had appointed him as the first),
Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. The sons and brothers of Hosah numbered 13 in all.

\w They|strong="H8179"\w* \w cast|strong="H5307"\w* \w lots|strong="H1486"\w* \w for|strong="H1004"\w* \w each|strong="H8179"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*, according \w to|strong="H1004"\w* \w their|strong="H5307"\w* \w families|strong="H1004"\w*, \w young|strong="H6996"\w* \w and|strong="H1419"\w* \w old|strong="H1419"\w* alike.

The lot for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah.\f + \fr 26:14 \ft Shelemiah is a variant of Meshelemiah; see verse 2.\f* Then lots were cast for his son Zechariah, a wise counselor, and the lot for the North Gate fell to him.
The lot for the South Gate fell to Obed-edom, and the lot for the storehouses to his sons.

The lots for the West Gate and the Shallecheth Gate on the ascending highway \f + \fr 26:16 \ft Or on the upper road\f* fell to Shuppim and Hosah. \w There|strong="H5927"\w* \w were|strong="H8179"\w* guards stationed \w at|strong="H5927"\w* \w every|strong="H5927"\w* \w watch|strong="H4929"\w*.

\w Each|strong="H3117"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w there|strong="H3117"\w* \w were|strong="H3881"\w* \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w* \w on|strong="H3117"\w* \w the|strong="H3117"\w* \w east|strong="H4217"\w*, four \w on|strong="H3117"\w* \w the|strong="H3117"\w* \w north|strong="H6828"\w*, four \w on|strong="H3117"\w* \w the|strong="H3117"\w* \w south|strong="H5045"\w*, \w and|strong="H3117"\w* \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w pairs|strong="H8147"\w* \w at|strong="H3117"\w* \w the|strong="H3117"\w* storehouse.

As \w for|strong="H8147"\w* \w the|strong="H8147"\w* court \f + \fr 26:18 \ft Hebrew parbar; twice in this verse\f* on \w the|strong="H8147"\w* \w west|strong="H4628"\w*, there \w were|strong="H8147"\w* four \w at|strong="H8147"\w* \w the|strong="H8147"\w* \w highway|strong="H4546"\w* \w and|strong="H8147"\w* \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w at|strong="H8147"\w* \w the|strong="H8147"\w* court.

These \w were|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w divisions|strong="H4256"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w gatekeepers|strong="H7778"\w* \w who|strong="H1121"\w* \w were|strong="H1121"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Korah|strong="H7145"\w* \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w Merari|strong="H4847"\w*. The Treasurers, Officers, and Judges

\w Now|strong="H5921"\w* \w their|strong="H5921"\w* fellow \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w* \w were|strong="H3881"\w* \f + \fr 26:20 \ft LXX; Hebrew As for the Levites, Ahijah was\f* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w charge|strong="H5921"\w* \w of|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* treasuries \w of|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w of|strong="H1004"\w* God \w and|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* treasuries \w of|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w dedicated|strong="H6944"\w* \w things|strong="H6944"\w*.

\w From|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Ladan|strong="H3936"\w*, \w who|strong="H1121"\w* \w were|strong="H1121"\w* \w Gershonites|strong="H1649"\w* through \w Ladan|strong="H3936"\w* \f + \fr 26:21 \ft Ladan is a variant of Libni; see 1 Chronicles 6:17.\f* \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w heads|strong="H7218"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w families|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Ladan|strong="H3936"\w* \w the|strong="H1121"\w* \w Gershonite|strong="H1649"\w*, \w were|strong="H1121"\w* \w Jehieli|strong="H3172"\w*,\f + \fr 26:21 \ft Jehieli is a variant of Jehiel; also in verse 22; see 1 Chronicles 23:8.\f*

\w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Jehieli|strong="H3172"\w*, \w Zetham|strong="H2241"\w*, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w his|strong="H3068"\w* brother \w Joel|strong="H3100"\w*. \w They|strong="H3068"\w* \w were|strong="H1121"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w charge|strong="H5921"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* treasuries \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w*.
From the \w Amramites|strong="H6020"\w*, the \w Izharites|strong="H3325"\w*, the \w Hebronites|strong="H2276"\w*, and the \w Uzzielites|strong="H5817"\w*:
Shebuel, a descendant of Gershom son of Moses, was the officer in charge of the treasuries.

His relatives through Eliezer included Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah \f + \fr 26:25 \ft Jeshaiah is a variant of Isshiah; see 1 Chronicles 24:21.\f* his son, Joram his son, Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.

This Shelomith and his brothers were in charge of all the treasuries for the things dedicated by King David, by the heads of families who were the commanders of thousands and of hundreds, and by the army commanders.
They had dedicated some of the plunder from their battles to the repair of the house of the LORD.

Everything that had been dedicated by Samuel the seer, Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah, along with everything else that was dedicated, was under the care of Shelomith and his brothers.
From the Izrahites, Chenaniah and his sons had the outside duties \f + \fr 26:29 \ft Or the duties outside (the temple) or the duties outside (Jerusalem)\f* as officers and judges over Israel.
From the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his relatives, 1,700 capable men, had charge of the affairs of Israel west of the Jordan for all the work of the LORD and for the service of the king.

As for the Hebronites, Jerijah \f + \fr 26:31 \ft Jerijah is a variant of Jeriah; see 1 Chronicles 23:19.\f* was the chief of the Hebronites, according to the genealogies of his ancestors. In the fortieth year of David’s reign the records were searched, and strong, capable men were found among the Hebronites at Jazer in Gilead.

Among Jerijah’s relatives there were 2,700 capable men who were heads of families. King David appointed them over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh for every matter pertaining to God and to the affairs of the king.
